thread.title: Self-Love Blogger Uses Tights To Show Body 'Transformation'
thread.title_full: Self-Love Blogger Uses Tights To Show Body 'Transformation'

author: Jenna Amatulli
title: Self-Love Blogger Uses Tights To Show Body 'Transformation'
text:
STYLE Self-Love Blogger Uses Tights To Show Body 'Transformation' â€œSame girl, same day, same time. Not a before and after. Not a weight loss transformation. Not a diet company promotion.â€ 01/31/2017 10:57 am ET 250 Jenna Amatulli Trends Editor, The Huffington Post 
If youâ€™re comparing yourself to what you scroll past on Instagram, then 23-year-old Milly Smith wants to open your eyes. 
The U.K.-based nursing student, new mom and body positivity champion recently posted an Instagram ( @selfloveclubb ) of two drastically different side-by-side photos, taken seconds apart. 
In the first, Smith is wearing control-top tights that give her the appearance of a flat stomach and hourglass shape. In the second photo, the tights are pulled below her stomach and the entire shape of her figure is changed. A photo posted by Milly Smith ğŸ’›ğŸŒ»â˜€ï¸ğŸ‘‘ (@selfloveclubb) on Jan 29, 2017 at 10:45am PST 
Smith writes in the caption, â€œ Same girl, same day, same time. Not a before and after. Not a weight loss transformation. Not a diet company promotion.â€ 
She elaborates that sheâ€™s comfortable with how her body looks in both images and stresses to her fans that they shouldnâ€™t compare themselves to other people. 
â€œJust live for you. There is no one on this planet whoâ€™s like you and thatâ€™s pretty damn amazing donâ€™t ya think. The world doesnâ€™t need another copy, it needs you. We are worthy, valid and powerful beyond measure,â€ she says. 
The side-by-side comparison has been done many times before, but this iteration shows just how deceptive angles and clothing can be to a silhouette. 
Smith frequently posts photos advocating body acceptance, including other side-by-sides to make a point that she (or the others sheâ€™s photographed) hasnâ€™t lost weight between one photo and the other. Itâ€™s simply photo â€œmagic.â€ A photo posted by Milly Smith ğŸ’›ğŸŒ»â˜€ï¸ğŸ‘‘ (@selfloveclubb) on Jan 24, 2017 at 8:26am PST A photo posted by Milly Smith ğŸ’›ğŸŒ»â˜€ï¸ğŸ‘‘ (@selfloveclubb) on Jan 16, 2017 at 1:11pm PST A photo posted by Milly Smith ğŸ’›ğŸŒ»â˜€ï¸ğŸ‘‘ (@selfloveclubb) on Dec 19, 2016 at 10:38am PST 
Take a tip from Milly: Love yourself and your body, regardless of how youâ€™re standing, sitting or posing!
